title: More Than Just Hype: Jakub Dunak on Building AI Systems People Can Trust
description: Artificial intelligence is shifting from the testing phase to real-world use, but weak infrastructure, poor data quality, and rising compliance issues still prevent it from doing so. Jakub Dunak, the principal architect at Ness Digital Engineering, shares why building for trust, not just speed, will shape the future of AI. In the second quarter of […]

title: Will AI take over jobs, but humans decide what's worth doing?
description: As artificial intelligence reshapes industries and daily life, the question of ethics and human judgment becomes more urgent than ever. At a recent convocation, leaders urged graduates to pair AI skills with values and moral clarity.
content: As the world rapidly embraces artificial intelligence, a new conversation is emerging, one that pairs technological capability with moral clarity. AI is transforming industries, workplaces, and everyday life, enabling machines to perform tasks once t... [3002 chars]

title: Ex-Apple CEO says OpenAI is the first real rival Apple has faced in decades
description: Former Apple CEO John Sculley believes that OpenAI is the first real competitor that the Cupertino giant has faced in decades. Sculley pointed out that Apple is struggling in the Artificial Intelligence (AI) race as the world shifts from apps to agentic models.
content: Former Apple CEO John Sculley believes that the Cupertino giant is facing a threat from OpenAI in the Artificial Intelligence (AI) race. Sculley insists that it is the first time “in many decades” that Apple has faced a “real competitor.” The former ... [2242 chars]

title: AI Is Here To Empower Humans Not Replace Them, Google Cloud CEO Kurian Assures
description: Artificial intelligence is here to empower humans not replace them, Google Cloud CEO Thomas Kurian said. His remarks came when concerns of a possible widespread job loss, especially in the IT industry, has increased.
content:
Artificial intelligence is here to empower humans not replace them, Google Cloud CEO Thomas Kurian said. His remarks came when concerns of a possible widespread job loss, especially in the IT industry, has increased.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Reportedly Drops $1.5 Billion Pay Packet To Snag Top AI Scientist From Mira Murati's Thinking Machines Lab
description: Meta has hired Thinking Machines Lab co-founder Andrew Tulloch after reportedly offering him a $1.5 billion compensation package, underscoring Mark Zuckerberg's aggressive campaign to recruit top AI talent and strengthen Meta's position in the artificial intelligence race.
content:
Meta Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ:META) has hired Andrew Tulloch, co-founder of Mira Murati's AI startup Thinking Machines Lab, marking another major addition to CEO Mark Zuckerberg's aggressive push to close the gap in advanced artificial intelligence.

title: Mass-produced AI podcasts disrupt a fragile industry
description: Artificial intelligence now makes it possible to mass-produce podcasts with completely virtual hosts, a development that is disrupting an industry still finding its footing and operating on a fragile business model.
content:

title: Colab Platforms to incorporate "Colab Intelligence Pvt. Ltd." a Wholly owned Subsidiary to Strengthen its Presence in USD 200 Billion Artificial Intelligence Sector
description: New Delhi [India], October 13: Colab Platforms a Diversified Technology Company, has announced plans to incorporate Colab Intelligence a wholly owned subsidiary. This strategic move marks a significant milestone in the company's long-term vision to strengthen its presence in the rapidly expanding Artificial Intelligence (AI) Sector, which is currently valued at approximately USD 200 billion globally in 2024 and projected to exceed USD 1.8 trillion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of over 30%.

title: ‘Literature is not only for those who write it, it is for everybody’: Javed Akhtar
description: On artificial intelligence, Akhtar describes it as “a powerful invention” but maintained that true creativity belongs to the human subconscious. “AI might have a higher IQ, but creativity doesn’t come from the conscious mind, it happens in the space between consciousness and the subconscious. That’s something no machine can replicate right now,” he said.
content:
Speaking at a session moderated by Suchetna Banerjee, Assistant Professor at Symbiosis School for Liberal Arts (SSLA, Akhtar said literature has the power to bridge human differences.
